Alice is an animal lover who adores collecting pictures of pets. In her room, she keeps a magical box filled with hundreds of photos of dogs and cats that she has taken or found from all over the internet.

But thereâ€™s a little problem...

Over time, Aliceâ€™s collection has gotten messy. Her box now contains a mix of dog photos, cat photos, and even some blurry or unrecognizable images. She needs a smart system to help her sort through the mess and organize everything again.

ğŸ§  Your Mission
Youâ€™re building an intelligent system that can analyze each image in Aliceâ€™s magical box and decide what it contains. Each image will fall into one of the following categories:

ğŸ¶ If the image contains dogs:

There may be one or more dogs in the photo.

Your system should detect all visible dogs, identify their breed, and return the most frequent breed in the image.

ğŸ± If the image contains a single cat:

Look at the catâ€™s facial expression and determine its most likely emotion â€” such as "happy", "angry", "curious", or "relaxed".

â“ If the image is unclear (e.g., no visible pet or the view is too blurry):

The system should simply return "unsure" to avoid making a wrong guess.

ğŸ“¦ The Contents of Aliceâ€™s Box
The images are stored in the following directory:

images/

Each image is in .jpg or .png format, typically containing a pet in the foreground.

ğŸ“ Expected Output
After processing, your system should save the result to file output.csv with format:

id: the image filename without extension (e.g., 001.png â†’ id = 001)
